prompt: Please generate an op note for a 74 year old male presenting with obstructing airway lesion. We found the existing stent in the Distal Trachea had migrated towards the vocal cords. We performed a stent exchange removing the Merit and placing a Aero sized 12mm x 60mm. Also did APC and BAL at Superior Segment of LLL (Lb6).
completion:
DATE OF PROCEDURE: February 10, 2026 INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 74-year-old male who presents with obstructing airway lesion.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

Airway stenosis (Distal Trachea, LMSB, RMSB) 

Stent migration 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration, initial episode (31645) 

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624) 

Endobronchial Biopsy(s) (31625) 

Balloon dilation (31630) – Bilateral/Multiple sites (Distal Trachea, LMSB, RMSB) 

Bronchial stent placement, initial bronchus (31636) 

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640) 

Destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (31641) 

Foreign body removal (Stent removal) (31635) 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout 
the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Rigid Bronchoscope; Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC (FiAPC probe); Pulmonary forceps; Hercules balloons (10/11/12 and 12/13.5/15).
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Initial Airway Inspection (via LMA) The laryngeal mask airway was in good position.

Larynx/Trachea: Normal. Vocal cords normal without mass/lesions.
Trachea normal.


Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Trachea (Distal Trachea).
The existing metallic stent in the Distal Trachea had migrated towards the vocal cords, leaving a stenotic and mucous plugging and malacia distal to the stent.
Copious purulent secretions was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the Distal Trachea; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the suture line was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (FiAPC probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Superior Segment of LLL (Lb6) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.
Rigid Bronchoscopy & Stent Exchange The LMA was removed, and a rigid bronchoscope was introduced.
The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.
Stent Removal: The patient's existing Merit 10mm x 40mm stent was grasped with pulmonary forceps and removed en bloc.
Balloon Dilation (Distal Trachea): A 12/13.5/15 Hercules balloon was used to dilate the Distal Trachea to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Aero (12mm x 60mm) was placed in the Trachea.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 12/13.5/15 Hercules balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (LMSB, RMSB): Dilated using 10/11/12 Hercules balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto) 

Distal Trachea endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Trachea stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

74-year-old male with airway stenosis and migrated towards the vocal cords of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Aero 12mm x 60mm re-placed in the Distal Trachea.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

Initial Airway Inspection (via LMA) The laryngeal mask airway was in good position.

Trachea normal.


Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Right Mainstem Bronchus (RMSB).
The existing metallic stent in the RMSB had migrated proximally touching the carina, leaving a stenotic and granulation tissue overgrowth at proximal edge.
Copious purulent secretions was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the RMSB; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the distal trachea was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (FiAPC probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.

Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (LMSB, RUL, RLL): Dilated using 8/9/10 Elation balloon.

Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Superior Segment of LLL (Lb6) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.
Rigid Bronchoscopy & Stent Exchange The LMA was removed, and a rigid bronchoscope was introduced.
The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.
Stent Removal: The patient's existing Merit 14mm x 40mm stent was grasped with pulmonary forceps and removed en bloc.
Balloon Dilation (Distal Trachea): A 8/9/10 Elation balloon was used to dilate the Distal Trachea to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Ultraflex (12mm x 60mm) was placed in the Trachea.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 8/9/10 Elation balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (LMSB, RMSB): Dilated using 12/13.5/15 Elation balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto) 

Distal Trachea endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Trachea stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

71-year-old female with airway stenosis and migrated towards the vocal cords of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Ultraflex 12mm x 60mm re-placed in the Distal Trachea.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

Distal Trachea endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Trachea stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

74-year-old male with airway stenosis and migrated towards the vocal cords of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Aero 10mm x 50mm re-placed in the Distal Trachea.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

prompt: Please generate an op note for a 71 year old male presenting with worsening dyspnea and stridor. We found the existing stent in the LMSB had migrated distally. We performed a stent exchange removing the Merit and placing a Aero sized 14mm x 50mm. Also did APC and BAL at Anteromedial Segment of LLL (Lb7/8).
completion:
DATE OF PROCEDURE: January 31, 2026 INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 71-year-old male who presents with worsening dyspnea and stridor.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was obtained.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.
PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

Airway stenosis (LMSB, RMSB, LUL, LLL) 

Stent migration 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration, initial episode (31645) 

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624) 

Endobronchial Biopsy(s) (31625) 

Balloon dilation (31630) – Bilateral/Multiple sites (LMSB, RMSB, LUL, LLL) 

Bronchial stent placement, initial bronchus (31636) 

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640) 

Destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (31641) 

Foreign body removal (Stent removal) (31635) 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout 
the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Rigid Bronchoscope; Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC (Circumferential probe); Pulmonary forceps; Hercules balloons (8/9/10 and 10/11/12).
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Initial Airway Inspection (via LMA) The laryngeal mask airway was in good position.

Larynx/Trachea: Normal. Vocal cords normal without mass/lesions.
Trachea normal.


Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB).
The existing metallic stent in the LMSB had migrated distally, leaving a stenotic and highly malacic ~1cm section proximal to the stent.
Copious purulent secretions was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the LMSB; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the right mainstem anastomosis was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (Circumferential probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Anteromedial Segment of LLL (Lb7/8) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.
Rigid Bronchoscopy & Stent Exchange The LMA was removed, and a rigid bronchoscope was introduced.
The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.
Stent Removal: The patient's existing Merit 12mm x 40mm stent was grasped with pulmonary forceps and removed en bloc.
Balloon Dilation (LMSB): A 10/11/12 Hercules balloon was used to dilate the LMSB to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Aero (14mm x 50mm) was placed in the Left Mainstem Bronchus.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 10/11/12 Hercules balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (RMSB, LUL, LLL): Dilated using 8/9/10 Hercules balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto) 

LMSB endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Left Mainstem Bronchus stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

71-year-old male with airway stenosis and migrated distally of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Aero 14mm x 50mm re-placed in the LMSB.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

Airway stenosis (RMSB, LMSB, RUL, RLL) 

Stent migration 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration, initial episode (31645) 

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624) 

Endobronchial Biopsy(s) (31625) 

Balloon dilation (31630) – Bilateral/Multiple sites (RMSB, LMSB, RUL, RLL) 

Bronchial stent placement, initial bronchus (31636) 

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640) 

Destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (31641) 

Foreign body removal (Stent removal) (31635) 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout 
the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Rigid Bronchoscope; Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC (Circumferential probe); Pulmonary forceps; Elation balloons (12/13.5/15 and 8/9/10).
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Initial Airway Inspection (via LMA) The laryngeal mask airway was in good position.

Larynx/Trachea: Normal. Vocal cords normal without mass/lesions.
Trachea normal.


Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Right Mainstem Bronchus (RMSB).
The existing metallic stent in the RMSB had migrated proximally touching the carina, leaving a stenotic and granulation tissue overgrowth at proximal edge.
Moderate mucoid secretions was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the RMSB; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the distal trachea was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (Circumferential probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Lateral Segment of RML (Rb4) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.
Rigid Bronchoscopy & Stent Exchange The LMA was removed, and a rigid bronchoscope was introduced.
The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.
Stent Removal: The patient's existing Merit 12mm x 40mm stent was grasped with pulmonary forceps and removed en bloc.
Balloon Dilation (RMSB): A 8/9/10 Elation balloon was used to dilate the RMSB to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Bonastent (14mm x 50mm) was placed in the Right Mainstem Bronchus.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 8/9/10 Elation balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (LMSB, RUL, RLL): Dilated using 12/13.5/15 Elation balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto) 

RMSB endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Right Mainstem Bronchus stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

79-year-old female with airway stenosis and migrated proximally touching the carina of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Bonastent 14mm x 50mm re-placed in the RMSB.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB).
The existing metallic stent in the LMSB had migrated distally, leaving a stenotic and highly malacic ~1cm section proximal to the stent.
Moderate mucoid secretions was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the LMSB; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the right mainstem anastomosis was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (Straightfire probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Anteromedial Segment of LLL (Lb7/8) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.
Rigid Bronchoscopy & Stent Exchange The LMA was removed, and a rigid bronchoscope was introduced.
The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.
Stent Removal: The patient's existing Boston Scientific 14mm x 40mm stent was grasped with pulmonary forceps and removed en bloc.
Balloon Dilation (LMSB): A 10/11/12 Hercules balloon was used to dilate the LMSB to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Aero (14mm x 50mm) was placed in the Left Mainstem Bronchus.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 10/11/12 Hercules balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (RMSB, LUL, LLL): Dilated using 12/13.5/15 Hercules balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto) 

LMSB endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Left Mainstem Bronchus stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

55-year-old male with airway stenosis and migrated distally of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Aero 14mm x 50mm re-placed in the LMSB.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

Balloon Dilation (Distal Trachea): A 10/11/12 CRE balloon was used to dilate the Distal Trachea to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Aero (14mm x 50mm) was placed in the Trachea.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 10/11/12 CRE balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (LMSB, RMSB): Dilated using 8/9/10 CRE balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto)

Trachea stent (pathology)

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

Stent migration

Therapeutic aspiration, initial episode (31645) 

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624) 

Endobronchial Biopsy(s) (31625) 

Balloon dilation (31630) – Bilateral/Multiple sites (LMSB, RMSB, LUL, LLL) 

Bronchial stent placement, initial bronchus (31636) 

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640) 

Destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (31641) 

Foreign body removal (Stent removal) (31635) 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout 
the entire procedure.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Initial Airway Inspection (via LMA) The laryngeal mask airway was in good position.

Larynx/Trachea: Normal. Vocal cords normal without mass/lesions.
Trachea normal.


Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB).
The existing metallic stent in the LMSB had migrated distally, leaving a stenotic and highly malacic ~1cm section proximal to the stent.
Thick tenacious mucus was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the LMSB; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the distal trachea was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (FiAPC probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Anteromedial Segment of LLL (Lb7/8) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.

The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.

Balloon Dilation (LMSB): A 10/11/12 CRE balloon was used to dilate the LMSB to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).

Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 10/11/12 CRE balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (RMSB, LUL, LLL): Dilated using 12/13.5/15 CRE balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

Balloon dilation (31630) – Bilateral/Multiple sites (RMSB, LMSB, RUL, RLL) 

Bronchial stent placement, initial bronchus (31636) 

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640) 

Destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (31641) 

Foreign body removal (Stent removal) (31635) 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout 
the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Rigid Bronchoscope; Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC (Straightfire probe); Pulmonary forceps; Elation balloons (10/11/12 and 8/9/10).
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Initial Airway Inspection (via LMA) The laryngeal mask airway was in good position.

Larynx/Trachea: Normal. Vocal cords normal without mass/lesions.
Trachea normal.


Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Right Mainstem Bronchus (RMSB).
The existing metallic stent in the RMSB had migrated proximally touching the carina, leaving a stenotic and granulation tissue overgrowth at proximal edge.
Copious purulent secretions was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the RMSB; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the right mainstem anastomosis was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (Straightfire probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Lateral Segment of RML (Rb4) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.
Rigid Bronchoscopy & Stent Exchange The LMA was removed, and a rigid bronchoscope was introduced.
The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.
Stent Removal: The patient's existing MicroTech 14mm x 40mm stent was grasped with pulmonary forceps and removed en bloc.
Balloon Dilation (RMSB): A 8/9/10 Elation balloon was used to dilate the RMSB to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Aero (14mm x 50mm) was placed in the Right Mainstem Bronchus.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 8/9/10 Elation balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (LMSB, RUL, RLL): Dilated using 10/11/12 Elation balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto) 

RMSB endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Right Mainstem Bronchus stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

55-year-old female with airway stenosis and migrated proximally touching the carina of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Aero 14mm x 50mm re-placed in the RMSB.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

Secondary sites (RMSB, LUL, LLL): Dilated using 10/11/12 Hercules balloon.

J98.09 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

Airway stenosis (LMSB, RMSB, LUL, LLL) 

Stent migration 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration, initial episode (31645) 

Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624) 

Endobronchial Biopsy(s) (31625) 

Balloon dilation (31630) – Bilateral/Multiple sites (LMSB, RMSB, LUL, LLL) 

Bronchial stent placement, initial bronchus (31636) 

Bronchoscopy with excision (31640) 

Destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method other than excision (APC) (31641) 

Foreign body removal (Stent removal) (31635) 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout 
the entire procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Rigid Bronchoscope; Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; APC (Circumferential probe); Pulmonary forceps; Hercules balloons (10/11/12 and 10/11/12).
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS Minimum 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location.
Initial Airway Inspection (via LMA) The laryngeal mask airway was in good position.

Larynx/Trachea: Normal. Vocal cords normal without mass/lesions.
Trachea normal.


Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB).
The existing metallic stent in the LMSB had migrated distally, leaving a stenotic and highly malacic ~1cm section proximal to the stent.
Copious purulent secretions was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the LMSB; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the distal trachea was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (Circumferential probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Anteromedial Segment of LLL (Lb7/8) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.
Rigid Bronchoscopy & Stent Exchange The LMA was removed, and a rigid bronchoscope was introduced.
The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.
Stent Removal: The patient's existing Merit 10mm x 40mm stent was grasped with pulmonary forceps and removed en bloc.
Balloon Dilation (LMSB): A 10/11/12 Hercules balloon was used to dilate the LMSB to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Ultraflex (12mm x 60mm) was placed in the Left Mainstem Bronchus.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 10/11/12 Hercules balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (RMSB, LUL, LLL): Dilated using 10/11/12 Hercules balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto) 

LMSB endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Left Mainstem Bronchus stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

71-year-old male with airway stenosis and migrated distally of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Ultraflex 12mm x 60mm re-placed in the LMSB.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.

Main Carina: Somewhat splayed with granulation tissue noted.
Right Lung: Stenosis noted at the anastomosis/suture line with granulation tissue.
Left Lung: Stenosis noted at the Left Mainstem Bronchus (LMSB).
The existing metallic stent in the LMSB had migrated distally, leaving a stenotic and highly malacic ~1cm section proximal to the stent.
Copious purulent secretions was noted within the stent.

Therapeutic Interventions


Therapeutic Aspiration: Performed to clear mucus from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem, Carina.
Biopsy & Tissue Removal: Endobronchial biopsy was performed at the LMSB; the lesion was successfully removed.
Stenosis/Granulation Treatment: Granulation tissue causing stenosis at the distal trachea was treated.
Mechanical destruction was performed using pulmonary forceps, followed by APC ablation (FiAPC probe, Forced coag, Effect 2) for destruction and hemostasis.
Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL): Performed at the Anteromedial Segment of LLL (Lb7/8) with 60 cc NS instilled and 20 cc return.
Rigid Bronchoscopy & Stent Exchange The LMA was removed, and a rigid bronchoscope was introduced.
The vocal cords were identified, and the scope was advanced to the distal trachea; jet ventilation was initiated.
Stent Removal: The patient's existing MicroTech 14mm x 40mm stent was grasped with pulmonary forceps and removed en bloc.
Balloon Dilation (LMSB): A 10/11/12 Elation balloon was used to dilate the LMSB to 12 mm (1 inflation, 60 seconds).
Stent Placement: A new Ultraflex (10mm x 50mm) was placed in the Left Mainstem Bronchus.
Post-Deployment Dilation: The stent was dilated using a 10/11/12 Elation balloon to expand and seat the stent (4 inflations, 30 seconds each).
Additional Balloon Dilations


Secondary sites (RMSB, LUL, LLL): Dilated using 10/11/12 Elation balloon.
The rigid bronchoscope was extubated, the LMA replaced, and lidocaine applied to the vocal cords.
The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.
SPECIMENS

BAL (cell count, micro, cyto) 

LMSB endobronchial forceps biopsies (pathology) 

Left Mainstem Bronchus stent (pathology) 

IMPRESSION/PLAN

55-year-old male with airway stenosis and migrated distally of existing stent.
Existing stent removed; Ultraflex 10mm x 50mm re-placed in the LMSB.
Multilevel balloon dilation performed and granulation tissue ablated.

Follow-up BAL and pathology results.
Continue stent hydration therapy regimen.

Repeat bronchoscopy in approximately 4 weeks for re-evaluation.
